text:
A Heavy Truth

Dimly lit room, tension rising  
Sonia: "Could it all be true?!"  
Sonia: "How could you give away everything?"  

---  

Same room, Raskolnikov distressed  
Raskolnikov: "That money was mine—my own."  
Sonia: "But why did you rob?"  

---  

Close-up, Raskolnikov reflecting  
Raskolnikov: "I haven’t decided to take it."  
Raskolnikov: "Ach, what silly thoughts!"

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov struggles with the moral implications of his crime, revealing his inner turmoil and confusion about his motivations.
